title: Alpha Client "Failed to create dump file..."

embed.description: The easy way to save screenshots, GIFs, and websites. Make everyone happy by sharing smarter, faster, and with your point crystal clear.

body:
I keep getting the error (as seen in the image) when I try to boot up the Alpha Client, followed by "League Alpha Client has stopped working". It has only started doing this recently. I have been in the loop since early on so this is rather new to me. I have uninstalled and reinstalled and looked up other fixes, yet I don't use a laptop and the programs mentioned that need to be disabled I do not have. Old client works fine, just wondering why this happens and how to fix it, as well as if it's possible it would be an issue for when we switch to the Alpha Client.
** _It doesn't need to be fixed if the client will work fine after the switch but it would be nice._**

replies.body:
Interesting. I've only seen this happen with Lenovo Y700 laptops. There may be a similar app running in the background that was causing issues on the Lenovos. I suggest taking a wack at [performing a clean boot](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting#wq3) to ensure this isn't the case.

Let me know if that changed anything.
I did the clean boot and one of the apps is certainly the cause. I'll look through everything and figure out what it is exactly, thank you so much!

Looks like its actually Steel Series Engine 3 that's messing it up. I recently got an Arctis 3 headset and installed the engine and that's around the time it started happening; feel kind of dumb for not making the connection but I'm also not sure why it's doing it.

We've seen this specifically with applications that attempt to modify your system's audio settings. I'm betting there's something in the Alpha Client that doesn't like that so much. Thanks for confirming the name of the problematic app for me.

This also goes for sonic studio 3 as well. i have to shut down the process for it just for the alpha client to launch. This is on the Asus ROG G752. i think alpha client doesn't these nifty Audio applications like ya said.
